title.romaji: Kami no Tou: Tower of God

description:
There is a tower that summons chosen people called "Regulars" with the promise of granting their deepest desires. Whether it be wealth, fame, authority, or something that surpasses them all—everything awaits those who reach the top.

Twenty-Fifth Bam is a boy who had only known a dark cave, a dirty cloth, and an unreachable light his entire life. So when a girl named Rachel came to him through the light, his entire world changed. Becoming close friends with Rachel, he learned various things about the outside world from her. But when Rachel says she must leave him to climb the Tower, his world shatters around him. Vowing to follow after her no matter what it takes, he sets his sight on the tower, and a miracle occurs.

Thus begins the journey of Bam, a young boy who was not chosen by the Tower but opened its gates by himself. They call his kind "Irregulars"—beings that have shaken the very foundation of the Tower each time they set foot inside it.

tags.name: Super Power
tags.description: Prominently features characters with special abilities that allow them to do what would normally be physically or logically impossible.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Survival
tags.description: Centers around the struggle to live in spite of extreme obstacles.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Cultivation
tags.description: Features characters using training, often martial arts-related, and other special methods to cultivate qi (a component of traditional Chinese philosophy, described as "life force") and gain strength or immortality.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Shounen
tags.description: Target demographic is teenage and young adult males.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Travel
tags.description: Centers around character(s) moving between places a significant distance apart.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://x.com/siu3334_) | [Naver Blog](http://blog.naver.com/inutero3334)

SIU stands for "Slave In Utero." He is widely known for his series Tower of God.

[Website](http://straykids.jype.com/) | [Website (Japan)](straykidsjapan.com) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/JYPEStrayKids/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Stray_Kids) | [Twitter (Japan)](https://twitter.com/Stray_Kids_JP) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/realstraykids/) | [Instagram (Japan)](https://www.instagram.com/straykids_official_jp/) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/JYPEStrayKids/)
| [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/c/StrayKids)

Stray Kids is a South Korean boy band formed by JYP Entertainment through the 2017 reality show of the same name. The group released their extended play *Mixtape* on January 8, 2018 and officially debuted on March 25 with *I Am Not*.

**Members:**

- **[Bang Chan (방찬)](https://anilist.co/staff/168750)** - *Leader, rapper, vocalist*
- **Lee Know (리노)** - *Vocalist, rapper*
- **[Changbin (창빈)](https://anilist.co/staff/168751)** - *Rapper*
- **Hyunjin (현진)** - *Rapper*
- **[Han (한)](https://anilist.co/staff/168749)** - *Rapper, vocalist*
- **[Felix (필릭스)](https://anilist.co/staff/350644)** - *Rapper*
- **Seungmin (승민)** - *Vocalist*
- **I.N (아이엔)** - *Vocalist*

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Kudo_M_) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kudo_m_/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCVcxdd04vCuhr-1t7mDh3gg)

Originating from [Artland](https://anilist.co/studio/8/). Most known for his work on the [Bleach](https://anilist.co/anime/269/) franchise.

__Origin:__ Perth, Australia
__Alma Mater:__ Royal College of Music (2015)

[Website](https://www.kpenkmusic.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/kevinpenkin) | [Facebook](https://www.facebook.com/kevinpenkincomposer) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/kpenkin) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCD05wgzXUYvA7rIE3XGfFFg) | [Twitch](https://www.twitch.tv/kevinpenkin) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kevin_Penkin)

An Australian anime composer and video game composer. He is best known for composing the award-winning score to the anime [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/).

Penkin grew up in Perth, Australia. His interest in game music came from listening to the "Phendrana Drifts" theme from Metroid Prime; in a 2012 interview, he referred to the theme's electronic synths and acoustic instruments as "absolute bliss." Penkin began his career with composition credits in the 2011 short films Play Lunch and The Adventures of Chipman and Biscuit Boy. In the same year, Penkin composed the soundtrack of the video game Jūzaengi: Engetsu Sangokuden; this soundtrack represented Penkin's first collaboration with [Nobuo Uematsu](https://anilist.co/staff/100150). Penkin has continued to collaborate with Uematsu in titles such as Norn9 and Defender’s Quest II: Mists of Ruin.

In 2015, Penkin graduated from the Royal College of Music with a Master's degree in Composition for Screen. In 2016, Penkin collaborated with [Kinema Citrus](https://anilist.co/studio/290/) on the [Norn9](https://anilist.co/anime/20643/) anime and the [Under the Dog](https://anilist.co/anime/21002/) original video animation soundtracks. Penkin's relationship with Kinema Citrus continued through to 2017 for the soundtrack of [Made in Abyss](https://anilist.co/anime/97986/), winning the 2017 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it. In 2018, Penkin composed the score for the video game Florence. Penkin composed the music for Kinema Citrus' adaptation of [The Rising of the Shield Hero](https://anilist.co/anime/99263/) and NetEase's VR game Nostos in 2019. Penkin most recently composed the music for the 2020 anime adaptation of the South Korean webtoon [Tower of God](https://anilist.co/anime/115230/), winning the 2021 Crunchyroll Anime Award for Best Score with it.

He used to live in the United Kingdom, but currently resides in Melbourne, Australia.
_Note: Not to be confused with the [director](https://anilist.co/staff/235529)._

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tanino_miho) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tanino_miho/)

Animator and designer affiliated to [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/Telecom-Animation-Film)

She started off as a painter in the early '80s, and then switched to photography work. Stopped doing photography when animation switched to digital and nowadays just focuses on special effects.

Titular member of Team Taniguchi, a subsidiary of [Madhouse](https://anilist.co/studio/11/) specializing in special effects.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tanino_miho) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/tanino_miho/)

Animator and designer affiliated to [Telecom Animation Film](https://anilist.co/studio/94/Telecom-Animation-Film)
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.
Veteran animator specialized in effects animation.
